newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ job ad market slackens in May - ANZ Bank.
newsitem.headline: NZ job ad market slackens in May - ANZ Bank.

text.p: The trend number of New Zealand job ads fell 0.2 percent in May, and by 4.8 percent in annual terms, ANZ Bank said on Tuesday.

"The fall in job advertising over the past year, in all three main urban areas, is consistent with the subdued economic climate which has led to a fall in company profitability and weaker business confidence," the bank said.
Job ads in Auckland rose during May but the increase was of a smaller magnitude than in previous months.
The trend number of Auckland job ads was up 0.3 percent following a 0.5 percent rise in April, and was down 1.8 percent when compared to May 1996.
Job ads in Wellington fell 0.4 percent in May, and were down 15.1 percent on May 1996.
Christchurch job ads fell 2.5 percent in May, and 12.5 percent in annual terms.
